cinnamon.engine.utils

Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.utils.Quaternion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copier<Quaternion>

    public final class Quaternion
extends Object
implements Copier<Quaternion>

    Rotation-oriented quaternion. All Quaternions are of unit length.

    If the x, y, or z component is non-zero, a rotation has occurred about the corresponding axis. Although Quaternion instances can only be created to represent a rotation about a single axis, instances can be combined through Hamilton multiplication in order to represent a sequence of rotations.

    The methods rotate(Point) and rotate(Vector) can be used to apply a Quaternion's rotations. Both are equivalent to the expression quat * vec4 * conjugateQuat.

        public Quaternion()

        Constructs a Quaternion in the un-rotated state (i.e. {w,x,y,z} is {1,0,0,0})

        public Quaternion(double angle,
                  Quaternion.Axis axis)

        Constructs a Quaternion from the specified axis and rotation about it.

        Parameters:
        angle - in radians.
        axis - x, y, or z axis.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if angle == 0 and axis != null, or angle != 0 while axis is null.
